tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3600]>

The name Simon and Garfunkel originates from the pairing of two American musicians: Paul Simon and Art Garfunkel <[silence:1200]>
Their partnership began in 1957 under the name Tom and Jerry—a nod to their youthful personas—before adopting their real names in 1964 <[silence:250]> reflecting artistic maturity <[silence:1200]>
The duo’s folk-rock harmonies <[silence:250]> rooted in 1960s counterculture <[silence:250]> became synonymous with introspective lyricism and melodic precision <[silence:1200]>

Three related concepts are folk revival <[silence:250]> vocal harmony traditions <[silence:250]> and songwriting as poetic narrative <[silence:3600]>
